verses.verse: My soul <S%H5315><s%> is weary <S%H5354><s%> of my life; <S%H2416><s%> I will leave <S%H5800><s%> my complaint <S%H7879><s%> on myself; I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
I will say <S%H559><s%> to God, <S%H433><s%> Do not condemn <S%H7561><s%> me; show <S%H3045><s%> me why <S%H5921><s%> <S%H4100><s%> you contend <S%H7378><s%> with me.

Is it good <S%H2896><s%> to you that you should oppress, <S%H6231><s%> that you should despise <S%H3988><s%> the work <S%H3018><s%> of your hands, <S%H3709><s%> and shine <S%H3313><s%> on the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked? <S%H7563><s%>
Have you eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh? <S%H1320><s%> or see <S%H7200><s%> you as man <S%H582><s%> sees? <S%H7200><s%>
Are your days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of man? <S%H582><s%> are your years <S%H8141><s%> as man's <S%H1397><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%>
That you enquire <S%H1245><s%> after my iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and search <S%H1875><s%> after my sin? <S%H2403><s%>
You know <S%H1847><s%> that I am not wicked; <S%H7561><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> that can deliver <S%H5337><s%> out of your hand. <S%H3027><s%>
Your hands <S%H3027><s%> have made <S%H6087><s%> me and fashioned <S%H6213><s%> me together <S%H3162><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about; yet you do destroy <S%H1104><s%> me.

Remember, <S%H2142><s%> I beseech <S%H4994><s%> you, that you have made <S%H6213><s%> me as the clay; <S%H2563><s%> and will you bring <S%H7725><s%> me into <S%H413><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> again? <S%H7725><s%>
Have you not poured <S%H5413><s%> me out as milk, <S%H2461><s%> and curdled <S%H7087><s%> me like cheese? <S%H1385><s%>
You have clothed <S%H3847><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh, <S%H1320><s%> and have fenced <S%H7753><s%> me with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews. <S%H1517><s%>
You have granted <S%H6213><s%> me life <S%H2416><s%> and favor, <S%H2617><s%> and your visitation <S%H6486><s%> has preserved <S%H8104><s%> my spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
And these <S%H428><s%> things have you hid <S%H6845><s%> in your heart: <S%H3824><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that this <S%H2063><s%> is with you.
If <S%H518><s%> I sin, <S%H2398><s%> then you mark <S%H8104><s%> me, and you will not acquit <S%H5352><s%> me from my iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I be wicked, <S%H7561><s%> woe <S%H480><s%> to me; and if <S%H518><s%> I be righteous, <S%H6663><s%> yet will I not lift <S%H5375><s%> up my head. <S%H7218><s%> I am full <S%H7646><s%> of confusion; <S%H7036><s%> therefore see <S%H7200><s%> you my affliction; <S%H6040><s%>
For it increases. <S%H1342><s%> You hunt <S%H6679><s%> me as a fierce <S%H7826><s%> lion: <S%H7826><s%> and again <S%H7725><s%> you show yourself marvelous <S%H6381><s%> on me.

You renew <S%H2318><s%> your witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> me, and increase <S%H7235><s%> your indignation <S%H3708><s%> on me; changes <S%H2487><s%> and war <S%H6635><s%> are against <S%H5973><s%> me.

Why <S%H4100><s%> then have you brought <S%H3318><s%> me forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the womb? <S%H7358><s%> Oh that I had given <S%H1478><s%> up the ghost, <S%H1478><s%> and no <S%H3808><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen <S%H7200><s%> me!
I should have been <S%H1961><s%> as though I had not been; <S%H1961><s%> I should have been carried <S%H2986><s%> from the womb <S%H990><s%> to the grave. <S%H6913><s%>
Are not my days <S%H3117><s%> few? <S%H4592><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> then, and let me alone, <S%H7896><s%> that I may take comfort <S%H1082><s%> a little, <S%H4592><s%>
Before <S%H2962><s%> I go <S%H3212><s%> from where I shall not return, <S%H7725><s%> even to the land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death; <S%H6757><s%>

A land <S%H776><s%> of darkness, <S%H5890><s%> as darkness <S%H652><s%> itself; and of the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death, <S%H6757><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> any order, <S%H5468><s%> and where the light <S%H3313><s%> is as darkness. <S%H652><s%>
